SEARCH
Package me.simulation.game

Class Map

java.lang.Object
me.simulation.game.Map
public class Map extends Object
Represents a map consisting of champions, chests, items, and potions. Provides methods to initialize and manipulate the map.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Map(int width, int height)
    Constructs a new Map with the specified dimensions.

  • Constructor Details

    • Map

      public Map(int width, int height)
      Constructs a new Map with the specified dimensions.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the map
      height - The height of the map

  • Method Details

    • getMap

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Champion>> getMap()
      Retrieves the map grid.
      Returns:
      The map grid as a two-dimensional ArrayList of Champions

    • placeObjectRandomly

      public void placeObjectRandomly(int howMuchOrk, int howMuchHuman, int howMuchElf, int howMuchChest, int howMuchItem, int howMuchPotion)
      Randomly places objects such as orks, humans, elves, chests, items, and potions on the map.
      Parameters:
      howMuchOrk - The number of orks to be placed
      howMuchHuman - The number of humans to be placed
      howMuchElf - The number of elves to be placed
      howMuchChest - The number of chests to be placed
      howMuchItem - The number of items to be placed
      howMuchPotion - The number of potions to be placed

    • mapDraw

      public void mapDraw()
      Draws the map on the console, representing the positions of champions and objects. Champions and objects are represented by specific characters and colors.

    • dayCycle

      public void dayCycle()
      Executes a cycle of the day, where objects on the map move and perform actions based on their behavior. Champions and objects may move to adjacent positions or stay in place. Additionally, their movement behavior may be influenced by their current health points.

    • printStats

      public void printStats()
      Prints the current statistics of the map, including the number of different objects and their status. The output is displayed with appropriate colors.

    • clear

      public static void clear()
      Clears the console screen. Note: This method might behave differently depending on the operating system.

    • ifend

      public boolean ifend()
      Checks if the game should end based on the remaining champions.
      Returns:
      true if the game should continue, false if the game should end.
